post.description:
Log in with your email address and password to generate a token scoped with your users roles.
            
```{ "email": "noreply@exceptionless.io", "password": "exceptionless" }```
            
This token can then be used to access the api. You can use this token in the header (bearer authentication)
or append it onto the query string: ?access_token=MY_TOKEN
            
Please note that you can also use this token on the documentation site by placing it in the
headers api_key input box.

get.summary: Logout the current user and remove the current access token

403.description: Current action is not supported with user access token

post.summary: Removes an external login provider from the account

parameters.description: The email address.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The password reset token.

parameters.description: A filter that controls what data is returned from the server.

parameters.name: aggregations
parameters.description: A list of values you want returned. Example: avg:value cardinality:value sum:users max:value min:value

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The time filter that limits the data being returned to a specific date range.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The time offset in minutes that controls what data is returned based on the time filter. This is used for time zone support.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: If no mode is set then the whole event object will be returned. If the mode is set to summary than a lightweight object will be returned.

post.description:
You can create an event by posting any uncompressed or compressed (gzip or deflate) string or json object. If we know how to handle it
we will create a new event. If none of the JSON properties match the event object then we will create a new event and place your JSON
object into the events data collection.
            
You can also post a multi-line string. We automatically split strings by the \n character and create a new log event for every line.
            
Simple event:
```
{ "message": "Exceptionless is amazing!" }
```
            
Simple log event with user identity:
```
{
    "type": "log",
    "message": "Exceptionless is amazing!",
    "date":"2030-01-01T12:00:00.0000000-05:00",
    "@user":{ "identity":"123456789", "name": "Test User" }
}
```
            
Multiple events from string content:
```
Exceptionless is amazing!
Exceptionless is really amazing!
```
            
Simple error:
```
{
    "type": "error",
    "date":"2030-01-01T12:00:00.0000000-05:00",
    "@simple_error": {
        "message": "Simple Exception",
        "type": "System.Exception",
        "stack_trace": "   at Client.Tests.ExceptionlessClientTests.CanSubmitSimpleException() in ExceptionlessClientTests.cs:line 77"
    }
}
```

parameters.name: userAgent
parameters.description: The user agent that submitted the event.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: The before parameter is a cursor used for pagination and defines your place in the list of results.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The after parameter is a cursor used for pagination and defines your place in the list of results.

post.description:
You can create an event by posting any uncompressed or compressed (gzip or deflate) string or json object. If we know how to handle it
we will create a new event. If none of the JSON properties match the event object then we will create a new event and place your JSON
object into the events data collection.
            
You can also post a multi-line string. We automatically split strings by the \n character and create a new log event for every line.
            
Simple event:
```
{ "message": "Exceptionless is amazing!" }
```
            
Simple log event with user identity:
```
{
    "type": "log",
    "message": "Exceptionless is amazing!",
    "date":"2030-01-01T12:00:00.0000000-05:00",
    "@user":{ "identity":"123456789", "name": "Test User" }
}
```
            
Multiple events from string content:
```
Exceptionless is amazing!
Exceptionless is really amazing!
```
            
Simple error:
```
{
    "type": "error",
    "date":"2030-01-01T12:00:00.0000000-05:00",
    "@simple_error": {
        "message": "Simple Exception",
        "type": "System.Exception",
        "stack_trace": "   at Client.Tests.ExceptionlessClientTests.CanSubmitSimpleException() in ExceptionlessClientTests.cs:line 77"
    }
}
```

get.description:
You can submit an event using an HTTP GET and query string parameters. Any unknown query string parameters will be added to the extended data of the event.
            
Feature usage named build with a duration of 10:
```/events/submit?access_token=YOUR_API_KEY&type=usage&source=build&value=10```
            
Log with message, geo and extended data
```/events/submit?access_token=YOUR_API_KEY&type=log&message=Hello World&source=server01&geo=32.85,-96.9613&randomproperty=true```

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The event type (ie. error, log message, feature usage).

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The event source (ie. machine name, log name, feature name).

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The event message.

parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: An optional identifier to be used for referencing this event instance at a later time.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date that the event occurred on.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of duplicated events.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value of the event if any.

parameters.name: geo
parameters.description: The geo coordinates where the event happened.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: A list of tags used to categorize this event (comma separated).

parameters.name: identity
parameters.description: The user's identity that the event happened to.

parameters.name: identityname
parameters.description: The user's friendly name that the event happened to.

parameters.name: userAgent
parameters.description: The user agent that submitted the event.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Query string parameters that control what properties are set on the event

400.description: No project id specified and no default project was found.

404.description: No project was found.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the organization.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: A cursor for use in pagination. before is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with obj_bar, your subsequent call can include before=obj_bar in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: A cursor for use in pagination. after is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100 items.

parameters.description: If no mode is set then the whole stack object will be returned. If the mode is set to summary than a lightweight object will be returned.
